title: Quiz 1 - Statement Argument
instruction: Directions: Each question given below is followed by two arguments numbered I and II. You have to decide which of the arguments is a ‘strong’ argument and which is a ‘weak’ argument.

quiz.text: Statement: Should correspondence course at university level be discontinued?Arguments: I. No. such courses are there in advanced countries like USA.II. Yes. It will substantially lessen the burden of the postal department.
options: if only argument I is strong
if only argument II is strong
if either I or II is strong
if neither I nor II is strong
if both I and II strong

quiz.text: Statement: Should state lotteries be banned?Arguments: I. Yes. The government should not promote gambling.II. No. The government will lose a large amount of revenue.
options: if only argument I is strong
if only argument II is strong
if either I or II is strong
if neither I nor II is strong
if both I and II strong

quiz.text: Statement: Should India give away Kashmir to Pakistan?Arguments: I. No. Kashmir is a beautiful state. It earns a lot of foreign exchange for India.II. Yes. This would help settle conflicts.
options: if only argument I is strong
if only argument II is strong
if either I or II is strong
if neither I nor II is strong
if both I and II strong

quiz.text: Statement: Should judiciary be independent of the executive? Arguments: I. Yes. This would help curb the unlawful activities of the executive. II. No. The executive would not be able to take bold measures.
options: if only argument II is strong
if only argument I is strong
if either I or II is strong
if neither I nor II is strong
if both I and II strong

quiz.text: Statement: Should so much money be spent on advertisements? Arguments: I. Yes. It is an essential feature of a capitalist economy.II. No. It leads to a wastage of resources.
options: if only argument I is strong
if only argument II is strong
if either I or II is strong
if neither I nor II is strong
if both I and II strong

quiz.text: Statement: Should shifting agriculture be practiced?Arguments: I. No. It is a wasteful practice.II. Yes. Modern methods of farming are too expensive.
options: if only argument I is strong
if only argument II is strong
if either I or II is strong
if neither I nor II is strong
if both I and II strong

quiz.text: Statement: Should loyalty be the only criterion for promotion in any organisation?Arguments: I. Yes. No organisation can function without loyal men.II. No. It leads to hypocrisy and partiality.
options: if only argument I is strong
if only argument II is strong
if either I or II is strong
if neither I nor II is strong
if both I and II strong

quiz.text: Statement: Should India encourage exports when most things are insufficient for internal use itself?Arguments: I. Yes. We have to earn foreign exchange to pay for our imports.II. No. Even selective encouragement would lead to shortages.
options: if only argument I is strong
if only argument II is strong
if either I or II is strong
if neither I nor II is strong
if both I and II strong

quiz.text: Statement: Should high chimneys be installed in industries? Arguments: I. Yes. It reduces pollution at ground level.II. No. It increases pollution in upper atmosphere.
options: if only argument I is strong
if only argument II is strong
if either I or II is strong
if neither I nor II is strong
if both I and II strong

quiz.text: Statement: Should jobs be delinked from academic degrees and diplomas? Arguments: I. No. A very large number of persons with hardly any academic qualifications will apply. II. No. Importance of higher education will be diminished.
options: if only argument I is strong
if only argument II is strong
if either I or II is strong
if neither I nor II is strong
if both I and II strong

quiz.text: Statement: Should so much money be spent on games and sports? Arguments: I. Yes. We are rich nation and can easily spare any amount of money for games and sports.II. No. Our teams are unable to put up a good show in international competitions.
options: if only argument I is strong
if only argument II is strong
if either I or II is strong
if neither I nor II is strong
if both I and II strong

quiz.text: Statement: Should workers be allowed to participate in the management of factories in India? Arguments: I. Yes. It is the present management theory. II. No. Many workers are illiterate and, so, their contributions will not be of any value.
options: if only argument I is strong
if only argument II is strong
if either I or II is strong
if neither I nor II is strong
if both I and II strong

quiz.text: Statement: Is monarchy better than democracy? Arguments: I. Yes. If the chair has one confirmed ruler, there are no ambitious aspirants fighting for it. II. No. People are more contented and happy in a democracy.
options: if only argument I is strong
if both I and II is strong
if either I or II is strong
if neither I nor II is strong
if II is strong

quiz.text: Statement: Should India manufacture atom bombs? Arguments: I. Yes. It is imperative to protect the sovereignty and integrity of the country.II. No. This will create imbalance in the power of nations in this region.
options: if only argument I is strong
if only argument II is strong
if either I or II is strong
if neither I nor II is strong
if both I and II strong

quiz.text: Statement: Should there be students union in college/university?Arguments: I. No. This will create a political atmosphere in the campus.II. Yes. It is very necessary. Students are the future political leaders.
options: if only argument I is strong
if only argument II is strong
if either I or II is strong
if neither I nor II is strong
if both I and II strong

quiz.text: Statement: Should luxury hotels be banned in India? Arguments: I. Yes. They are places from where international criminals operate. II. No. Affluent foreign tourists will have no place to stay.
options: if only argument I is strong
if only argument II is strong
if either I or II is strong
if neither I nor II is strong
if both I and II strong

quiz.text: Statement: Should the illiterate be debarred from voting? Arguments: I. yes They are easily misguided. II. No. It is their constitutional right.
options: if only argument I is strong
if only argument II is strong
if either I or II is strong
if neither I nor II is strong
if both I and II strong

quiz.text: Statement: Should mercy death be legalised? Arguments: I. Yes. Patients undergoing terrible suffering and having absolutely no chance of recovery should be liberated from suffering through mercy death.II. No. Even mercy death is a sort of killing and killing can never be legalised.
options: if only argument I is strong
if only argument II is strong
if either I or II is strong
if neither I nor II is strong
if both I and II strong

quiz.text: Statement: Should religion be taught in our schools? Arguments: I. No. Ours is a secular state. II. Yes. Teaching religion helps inculcate moral value among children.
options: if only argument I is strong
if only argument II is strong
if either I or II is strong
if neither I nor II is strong
if both I and II strong

quiz.text: Statement: Should non-vegetarian food be totally banned in our country?Arguments: I. Yes. It is expensive and, therefore, beyond the reach of most of the people in our country.II. No. Nothing should be banned in a democratic country.
options: if only argument I is strong
if only argument II is strong
if either I or II is strong
if neither I nor II is strong
if both I and II strong

quiz.text: Statement: Should a total ban be put on trapping wild animals? Arguments: I. Yes Trappers are making a lot of money.II. No. Bans on hunting and trapping are not effective.
options: if only argument I is strong
if only argument II is strong
if either I or II is strong
if neither I nor II is strong
if both I and II strong

quiz.text: Statement: Should there be a single government in the world? Arguments: I. Yes. It will help in eliminating tensions among the nations.II. No. Because then, only the developed countries will dominate in the government.
options: if only argument I is strong
if only argument II is strong
if either I or II is strong
if neither I nor II is strong
if both I and II strong

quiz.text: Statement: Should all the remote parts of a country be connected by road? Arguments: I. No. It will disturb peaceful simple life of the villagers. II. Yes. It must be done immediately.
options: if only argument I is strong
if only argument II is strong
if either I or II is strong
if neither I nor II is strong
if both I and II strong

quiz.text: Statement: Should agriculture in rural India be mechanised? Arguments: I. Yes. It would lead to higher production. II. No. It would lead to rural unemployment.
options: if only argument I is strong
if only argument II is strong
if either I or II is strong
if neither I nor II is strong
if both I and II strong

quiz.text: Statement: Should higher education be completely stopped for some time? Arguments: I. No. It will hamper the country’s progress. II. Yes. It will reduce educated unemployment.
options: if only argument I is strong
if only argument II is strong
if either I or II is strong
if neither I nor II is strong
if both I and II strong
